The steps are extracted based on the chronological order of actions described by Jacques Pepin, starting with the preparation of the shrimp and the poaching liquid, followed by the cooking process, and ending with the assembly and presentation of the dish.
dish_description: The dish is a shrimp cocktail that involves poaching shrimp in a seasoned liquid and serving them with a custom sauce. It's a variation on the classic shrimp cocktail, enhanced with flavors from pepper flakes, herbs, vinegar, and a spicy ketchup-based sauce.

cooking_steps.description: Prepare the shrimp by pressing on the tail to remove it, if desired, to have the tail fan out for presentation.

Create a flavorful poaching liquid by adding a good dash of pepper flakes, 1 cup of water, a dash of herbs de Provence or Italian seasoning, 1-2 tablespoons of white vinegar, and a couple of tablespoons of chopped onion to a pot.
Bring the poaching liquid to a boil and let it boil for about 5 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Prepare the cocktail sauce by mixing 2-3 tablespoons of ketchup, a good teaspoon of shirisha (likely meant to be sriracha), a teaspoon more of grated radish, and a dash of rice vinegar.
Strain the shrimp shells from the poaching liquid after they have imparted their flavor, retaining the liquid.
Return the strained liquid to the pot, add the shrimp, and bring it to a boil. Once it boils, turn off the heat and set it aside to cool with the shrimp still in the liquid.
Once the shrimp are cold and have been sitting in the liquid, arrange them on a serving dish, adding a bit of the flavorful poaching liquid for extra taste.
Garnish the dish with a little piece of basil or another herb for presentation and serve the shrimp cocktail with the prepared sauce.
